Reviews.Title: “Horrendous............!”
Reviews.Author: DebTheGerman
Reviews.Content: My daughter, 3 year old granddaughter and myself had the misfortune to stay at this hotel recently. The hotel is a nightmare - dingy dismal cramped rooms, dirty bedding and the staff - well what can I say! Apart from a helpful German lady on reception on the evening of our arrival, the rest were a nightmare! They were actually threatening and aggressive to me, in front of my family and demanded that I pay for my booking (which I had already done!). They then stated that they had not confirmed my booking and had no rooms available. When I produced my confirmation (received by e-mail from the hotel directly) they had egg on their faces. No-one spoke English and I was fortunate that I speak German - God help anyone who has the bad luck to stay at this hotel and doesn't! This hotel should be closed down immediately - it is the worst place I have ever stayed in and the worst service I have ever received. It is also situated in the middle of nowhere with no transport links close by. THINK TWICE BEFORE YOU STAY AT THIS HOTEL - IT IS NOT A PLEASANT EXPERIENCE.

Reviews.Title: “OK for 30 euros”
Reviews.Author: Yigal
Reviews.Content: The location is far from center: you'll have to walk 10 minutes to the U-Bahn, then take a ride of 40 minutes (change the trains once). The hotel is somewhat old, the carpeting is a bit dirty. The personal is very friendly though noone speaks English. The breakfast is good. For 30 euros I paid (the hotel regularily is sold for 60-80 euros) - sounds like a good deal, but if you are able to get something for 50 euros close to the center - do not save and take a better location.
